data.text: @AmitAryaMD You know that chart is incorrect... But you still post it. Yes, Canada should follow Denmark's path.

@Caerage @SSI_dk @AmitAryaMD Dear Dr JD,
Many people have good reasons to question doctors who only ask questions when the data doesn’t fit their preconceived opinion. COVID should be determined with the symptoms and signs included in its diagnosis. Let's keep it to that and avoid even more confusion.
@AmitAryaMD Cmon Dr you were doing so well for 2 years strong. This graph ain't it.
@MarkEdwardRobin @AmitAryaMD @maej43 Dude what are your oranges laced with? You're comparing a virus with oranges. Way, way beyond the proverbial apple.
@AmitAryaMD Based on that graph, numbers were already on the incline before Feb 1st then.

@SSI_dk @AmitAryaMD Dear SSI,
Many doctors have good reasons for questioning the died "with" vs. "from" distinction. As we know, COVID19 is a complex illness that can both exacerbate and precipitate other diseases. It would be instructive if you published exact diagnoses of people dead "with" COVID.

@AmitAryaMD They have a population of 5.8. That’s 30-35 deaths a day (with attribution issues of the cause of death) we can also take into account that a significant number of deaths could be attributed to people who contracted Covid at a much earlier date. 🤔
@AmitAryaMD In Canada- the death rate for cancer is approx 6.5 ppl/million per day. Better shut down until we get that under control too. 🙄

@AmitAryaMD This is the information I was referring to, published by the Statens Serum Instut, Denmark. Deaths rose in recent period due to high Omicron infection rates, similar to other jurisdiction around the world. https://t.co/8Y2cNb8YIw
